results.title: Take a little time: infection control at work
results.creator_credit: Hilary Christmas, Tanglefoot Productions, Victoria. Health Dept. AIDS STD Unit, Film Victoria and Fiona Banks
results.brief_description: Designed for emergency care workers and addresses the risks and prevention of the occupational transmission of communicable diseases, particularly HIV and Hepatitis B. Presented by Dr. Gael Jennings and accompanied by a 10p. booklet.

results.title: Take a letter, please
results.brief_description: Shows amusingly how bad dictation destroys stenographers’ morale and wastes valuable office hours. Burlesques the common faults of people who dictate letters, such as: The scatterbrain who isn’t prepared, the speed demon, the dreamer, Mr Mumblemush and Simon Legree. Concludes with a demonstration of the correct method to dictate a letter using a dictagraph machine.

results.title: Take a deep deadly breath. Part III
results.creator_credit: James Benjamin, ABC News (US) and Philip Burton
results.brief_description: Initially, the film seeks to make us aware of the constant danger of being contaminated by poisoned air when we are breathing. Secondly, it seeks to make us realise that the problem of chemical fallout is being neglected and getting worse. Part 3’s theme is “How can we get clean air?” and points out that three out of five Americans breathe dangerously polluted air while the list of polluted cities grows.

results.title: Take a deep deadly breath. Part II
results.creator_credit: James Benjamin, ABC News (US) and Philip Burton
results.brief_description: Initially, the film seeks to make us aware of the constant danger of being contaminated by poisoned air when we are breathing. Secondly, it seeks to make us realise that the problem of chemical fallout is being neglected and getting worse. Part 2 deals with the efforts of an American community to cope with the problem of air pollution.

results.title: Takahide Saita: shipyard foreman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Faces of Japan”
Focuses on the life of a shipyard worker in Tokyo, his work on ship construction, his position within the company, his relationship to his workers and his family life.

results.title: Taj Mahal
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir, Documentary Films of India and Mushir Ahmad
results.brief_description: A study of the Taj Mahal in Agra. An impression of the interior and exterior of the old mausoleum, and the surrounding gardens; story of Shar Jahan and the erection of Taj Mahal to the memory of his wife; the blending of Saracenic and Hindu styles in the architecture; the inlay work in some precious stones, marble bas-reliefs and the lace-like marble screens around the tombs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ezra Mir, Documentary Films of India and Mushir Ahmad

results.title: Taiwan; South Korea
results.creator_credit: Richard Carey, David Rabinovitch, Fumihiko Ninomiya, Leo Eaton, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mini Dragons”.
Although Taiwan is in many ways an exemplary example of an Asian country which has boomed economically whilst diminishing the gap between the rich and the poor, it suffers from political power being held undemocratically by the ruling KMT party, a historical legacy, uncontrolled pollution and the influence of Japan. South Korea, on the other hand, has the largest gap between the rich and poor causing political unrest and violent protest, which along with increased competition from other rising economic powers in Asia may end South Korea’s era of economic success.

results.title: Tail of a Tiger
results.creator_credit: James M. Vernon and Rolf De Heer
results.brief_description: Like all young kids, Orville Ryan is desperate to be part of a group. Unfortunately, the one he tries to gain acceptance from, is the local gang of neighbourhood bullies! And “this little dag” just doesn’t belong with them. So he is picked on, chased and battered. But through all this unfairness he happens upon an eccentric old man, who is given a hard time by the same boys. The two of them strike up a relationship based on their similar love for the freedom of flight and a broken down Tiger Moth. Orville persuades the recluse to rebuild the Moth - and Orville’s life takes off with it!
